task.title: Add or Change Employee Pay Check Details
task.shortdesc: Add or change employee pay check details, including instant and adjustment checks, on the View/Change Employee Pay Check page.

context.p: The View/Change Employee Pay Check page displays regular, additional, adjustment, or instant checks. Complete the following processes for each type of check:Depending on the way you access the Employee Pay Check Details screen (for example, when processing guided adjustment or standard adjustment checks), the page may appear with different field labels or editable information.

ul.li: Change earnings hours or dollar amounts
Delete the current check or recreate a new check of the same type
Change the columns that appear in the earnings, deductions, or taxes grid

step.cmd: From the View/Change Employee Pay Check page, if creating an instant check, complete the following:

ul.li: Select if the check is Post Only
Enter the check number (this field is not required if you select to print an off-cycle check)

Check the Gross Up box for a U.S. employee to add a gross up pay calculation for taxes and earnings.
Gross up pay calculations can be performed for flat amount earnings codes and taxes on additional and instant checks.
Select the Bypass Minimum Wage Validations box for a U.S. employee to continue processing the pay check without validating minimum wage requirements.

step.cmd: For all types of checks, select the tax frequency.
For a regular or additional pay, select the check distribution method.
From the Earnings area, complete one of the following:

ul.li: To change earnings, modify the hours or dollar amounts in a row.

step.cmd: In the Deductions area, complete one of the following:

ul.li: To change deductions, modify the dollar amounts in a row.
To change gross up earnings and tax amounts, modify the dollar amounts in a row.

info.note: When updating taxes for a Guided Adjustment, the earnings and deductions area is not editable.

step.cmd: From the Taxes area, modify a dollar amount, if applicable.
Select Save to recalculate the amounts and save the updated check.
